content: daybreak hat yarn bon tricot jolly dk 100% 87 5% bfl 12 5% gotland 140 yds / 128 m per 50g 5 skeins shown in mc sweatshirt c1 brick c2 honey mustard c3 fern c4 pink garnet needles & notions 2 75 mm and 3 25 mm us 2 and 3 16 / 40 cm circular needles and dpns or longer cable for magic loop stitch marker darning needle to weave in ends gauge 24 stitches & 30 row = 10 cm / 4 in stockinette after blocking sizes 1 2 3 finished measurements circumference 18 20 22 / 46 51 56 cm height 9 75 / 25 cm approx by naomi endicott the daybreak hat reminds me of the glowing colours of a new day yellow sun dawning through a pink and red-streaked sky over the dew-drenched grass featuring classic colourwork motifs in a simple beanie style it s the ideal introduction to stranded colourwork - and a quick-knit project with a great flow for more experienced knitters you ll be changing colours frequently so weaving and joining your ends as you go is worth the effort to minimize finishing later these are worked up in our hand-dyed house brand bon tricot in jolly dk a custom spun base of bfl with a hint of gotland which blooms beautifully when blocked espace tricot | www espacetricot com pattern with smaller needles cast on 108 120 132 sts using the long-tail method or your preferred stretchy cast-on method place marker and join to work in the round taking care not to twist stitches ribbing round *k2 p1 repeat from * to end repeat ribbing round 16 more times change to larger needles and begin the chart starting at round 1 tip if using fixed circular needles simply knit the first round onto the new needles if using interchangeable needles switch out the rh needle tip only for the first round then switch the lh needle tip this will help the stitches move smoothly so you aren t forcing a larger needle size into smaller stitches on the lh needle continue working rounds 2 55 of the chart chart is worked 9 10 11 times total each round 36 40 44 sts remain at the end of the chart size 1 decrease round 1 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 24 sts decrease round 2 k2tog to end 12 sts sizes 2 and 3 decrease round 1 *k2 k2tog repeat from * to end 30 33 sts decrease round 2 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 20 22 sts decrease round 3 k2tog to end 10 11 sts all sizes remove marker cut yarn leaving a tail at least 4 / 10 cm long thread yarn through live stitches and pull to close weave in ends and block in warm water with a little wool wash abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together mc main colour c x contrast colour 1/2/3/4 repeat repeat ssk slip-slip-knit st stitch
